title: A portrait session and digital art: Tuesday’s best photos
text:
Al-Araqib, Israel Sheikh Sayiah al-Turi, a Bedouin head of an unauthorised village in the Negev, drinks a cup of coffee near the southern city of Beersheva after casting his vote during the parliamentary election. The Bedouins of the Negev live on the margins of Israeli society, often in poverty. Like 34 other villages in the region, the village of Al-Araqeeb, which has no access to public water, no school or transport, is not recognised by the Israeli government.

Photograph: Hazem Bader/AFP/Getty Images
description: The Guardian’s picture editors select photo highlights from around the world
